author: Peperud
body:
Steps to reproduce ------------------ ```powershell Send-MailMessage -Priority High ` -From $NotificationFrom ` -To $NotificationTo ` -SmtpServer $SMTPServer ` -Subject "Attachment renamed in linux" ` -Body 'Test' ` -Attachments @('something.zip') ``` Expected behavior ----------------- 
Receive an attachment, named 'something.zip'
Actual behavior --------------- 
Received an attachment named folder1folder2folder3something.zip
where /folder1/folder2/folder3 is the current folder

Issue present on Linux only.
Environment data ---------------- ```powershell > $PSVersionTable Name Value ---- ----- PSVersion 6.1.0-preview.1 PSEdition Core GitCommitId v6.1.0-preview.1 OS Linux 4.4.0-119-generic #143-Ubuntu SMP Mon Apr 2 16:08:24 UTC 2018 Platform Unix PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0 ```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: The problem is in [corefx](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/abc007cbd6ef6180f1e044547d6441058122203a/src/System.Net.Mail/src/System/Net/Mail/Attachment.cs#L15) where they determine just the filename incorrectly expecting Windows directory separators.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Fix in corefx was merged, so we should get this when we pick up future corefx after 2.1 Preview2

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This should be fixed in latest nightly build w/ dotnetcore2.1-rc1

title: Send-MailMessage changes attachment file name on Linux
